comment: This is an amazing song. Full of heartfelt love touching questioning  feelings deep inside ❤

My 6th grade teacher used to play this all the time in our class room, (we were all considered elementary students still since our middle school was only 7th + 8th) and when it was the last day of school all of us hugged each other and cried. I still listen to this song and get emotional, thinking about that year
Amazing lyrics ❤️
I love the chorus
Man like maybe I just gotta think sometimes y’know life is good but sometimes I wonder,there is a version of me who is living a awful life rn
Nice beat ❤❤❤

I miss her so much so so much I’d give anything to get that version of her that loved me back all I feel is despair followed by despair this song resonates deep in my heart right now
love this tune  , but has dark tones that haunt

His lyrics are so damned depressing, he makes Alice in Chains sound like the Bee Gees. Yet, somehow, I can't stop listening.

listening on repeat because i love him more then anything in the world and i can’t even explain it but i made a giant rant it my notes about him and im so inlove but i have no chance and im crying over him like i always do and my friends told him everything and he hates me now because he knows i was stalking him a lot and now he stopped texting me and talking to me at all and we used to be so close but it’s all over and he’s moving schools next quarter because he lives far away from the school and like 1 1/2 hours away from me and the thought of him not being in my life just shatters my heart
This song is so much deeper and more painful than it sounds. I love every verse.
I really love this song its so emotional ❤❤
the subtitles seem like a translation for the meanings behind the lyrics, that's pretty dope
This is such a sad song but gods does it make me feel good. After an emotionally rough week, listening to this almost has me laughing. There's something so hopeful in the sound
Recently left primary school and we changed the lyrics to this song to fit snd we sung it to the whole school on thr last day❤ makes me think of prinsry school
At the end ov the day every one takes somthink different  from it emotionally and thats the point so thankyou for your song x❤
We can't be the only ones that thought he was saying "suck your mom" not "I saw your mom" 😂 had to check the lyrics! Lovely song though!!

I have just listened to this and ❤Omg..To be honest i have not heard any songs that have emotionally connected with me for a while. 🙂This Artist has achieved something that almost all Artists these days lack entirely...EMOTIONAL CONNECTION
I can pretty much relate this whole song to my dad walking out on us… after how many years and how many listens? Damn slow hitters are the worst
I thought the lyrics was "soccer mom..." LMAOOOAA not "saw your mom" oops

Heard this accidentally during my nephew's end of school musical today. Heard it before once or twice but never paid much attention to it. Tonight figured to look it up, and armed with just the word "sticks" and song, actually found the song (thankfully the title isn't something completely different). It's quite nice the lyrics are shown in the video, and reading along to the song it's a shame I never looked it up before. The lyrics really hit home and is a close second to a song called "bees" (the ballroom thieves), which has brilliant lyrics in my opinion. Anyway, thanks for makiing a song that's gonna be on repeat for a while.

"Some version of you that I might not have but I did not lose”: Last fall, my ex and I went on this short road trip through New England and we heard his entire album. Four months later she broke up with me. The lyrics are so accurate that I can't hear this song anymore without feeling being torn to pieces from each word.
I’m from Vermont and this is very special because because I can deeply understand the song
i get king of the hill vibes from this and i dont know why
such an emotional song 😢😢😢😢

a very paul simon vibe... nice

Our dude writes some of the most relatable songs about loss and heartbreak. The images his lyrics conjure up is impressive storytelling.
Dam....that's deep
Wow this song gif our a beautiful emotion❤

This entire song cuts so deep it makes your soul bleed that's how you know it's a great song! ❤

“No longer funny cause I miss the way you laugh” cuts so deep my ancestors felt it
Me and my best friend screamed the  lyrics

My wife lost her battle against suicide last year. I haven’t felt a thing since she passed, like a robot… until I heard this song on the radio today and I just lost it… I had to pull over. Beautiful, powerful lyrics. Once in a blue moon, a song is written in a certain way that could be meaningful to anybody listening. You nailed it. Keep it up!

"And I'll dream each night of some version of you that I might not have but I did not lose. Now you're tire tracks and one pair of shoes, and I'm split in half but that'll have to do" may be the most powerful lyrics I've ever heard. What a beautifully written song.
Heard this song for the first time yesterday and i cant stop listening to it. The lyrics are so emotional and powerful the one that got me most was "I'm split in half but that'll have to do"
Oh my heart. Someone like this comment so I can listen to this song in misery so my heart can beat ❤
Worst video with lyrics I’ve seen🤦‍♀️

cried smiled and absolutely screamed these lyrics. thank you for encapsulating the feelings most try to bury deep and ignore. the feels i am feeling are too much and absolutely breathtaking. thank you for this song, how incredible and how sad that so many can relate to such heartbreak, but incredible just the same that you can find solace in songs that make your heart hurt and heal at the very same time.

I louv listening to this song it is about just moving on accepting what didn't work out believing in yourself . Makes you want to travel , good road sing love the country vibes & I dwtect a little banjo or country instrument !☆😊😅

I'm 54, I literally discovered this song 3 hours ago, I can't stop playing it, the lyrics are so poignant   '' and I'll dream each night of some version of you, that I might not have but I did not lose '' blew me away, and  '' you once called me forever now you still can't call me back '' hurt my soul ever so slightly lol, I think I'm gonna have to check out Noah Kahan's music

Somehow the song can touch soft part of my heart even before I can follow to understand the lyrics on radio(it’s fast and my English listening sucks), now I found it by searching some short phrases I recited, and it is exactly what I thought it was singing about.

I finally had to Google the lyrics to settle my internal dispute, I thought it said " I loved your mom" but it's the season of the sticks!!! But it really does says "I love vermont" but it's the season of the sticks 😞 1:32  I only recently started to think it said something else and it turns out it does....

Caught this song on the radio, now reading the lyrics it's like reading my state of mind.

New favorite comfort song since most my old ones were written by a horrible person (yay /sar) anyways, I love the lyrics to this song (my mom does too) and it's so comforting.
"I'm no longer funny cause I miss the way you laugh." Incredible lyrics.
I get American Pie vibes (by Don McLean) when I listen to this song.

Damn this song hits me deep, I mean really deep in them feels.. it has nostalgia, a love lost, a life left to live and all the baggage that comes with it.. tears rolling down my cheeks thinking of the life I could have if only I’d done things differently, treated others and myself better than I did and accepted the love people gave me because now it’s all in the past and I’ll never get it back. I’ve learned the hard way, if you’re always looking to the future you never know what you’ve got until it’s gone and you’re chasing something that might not exist, love what you have now, more may come but you always lose it. Damn, my heart is broken right now 😢
First time hearing this.  Def shed a tear cuz of the lyrics.  Beautiful

I have learned of you and your music through Marianne's channel. She makes such lovely sad covers of your songs - and those really hit the right notes. You have a lovely voice mate, please make a duet with her.
Came here just to say how much i hate this gay ass fucking song. Hear it on the radio 24/7 at work at the melody and vocals are making my arse itch.

I find this song absolutely, excruciatingly, annoying. I'm hearing this every bleedin hour on the radio at work and the more I hear it the more it sounds like some redneck whinging about his life. And before I get bashed here for having a different opinion, and before someone says "if you don't like it don't listen" etc.....I have no bloody choice but to hear it
saw your mom she forgot that i existed wow just wow that hits emotionally i feel that with my mom and the part with dad my dad was an alcoholic 😞 hits home

Why do people feel the need to type the lyrics in the comments?

What I find amazing is that most songs make people realize the good and bad they have done, and I think that's amazing and the artist should be proud of themselves for doing that - this was said by a person who commented and I agree its amazing how strong words can affect a human I want everyone to realize this at the end of the day the jerk who bothered you underneath is also human and hey there's not a lot we can do when it comes to others behaviors but its amazing what a single song or word can make someone feel so when that jerk bothered you or they were indecent to you remind them I'm human and so are you I'm no more than that and you expect me to feel nothing when you comment about this or that but deep down everyone and when I say everyone I mean everyone has feelings so don't pretend like there not there don't pretend like others cant feel the pain you cause them and don't be oblivious to your own pain.. self pain can be harder because you know exactly what makes you feel hurt and you trick your brain to think the worst of you
This has been such an earworm for me! So catchy!
Great song. Glad to hear some quality lyrics, a non-autotuned song with acoustic guitar. Congrats on your top ten position.

I misinterpreted the lyrics and so I tried finding this song. Now that I'm here reading the lyrics, I see that it's can not only be talking about a partner but also a loved one. This brings me to my dad. Someone I loved, but never knew deeply unfortunately. He never talked to me except for the usual small talk. I was naive back then. I found out the hard truth about him and now that he passed, I wish I could've asked him why. Nonetheless, this song reminds me of the nice times when he took me and my siblings out to bowling and even though he's not here doesn't mean I should put my life on hold.

Trying to learn this song and the hardest lyrics are for me musically and emotionally are “ that I could cancel out all the darkness I inherited from dad “ …. Powerful song straight in to my top ten of all time and there is some legends and pioneers of song writing in that ten! Give us more Noah when your ready you are extremely talented
this is the worst song i’ve heard

So after a rough acid trip i cry at certain songs. I absolutely cant hold back tears listening to this. It hits me so hard everytime and its not even that it "speaks to me" or anything like that, its just the emotion and implication, i shed a tear every time i try to listen to this.
Wow this song has such a vibe man!! When i first heared it i was instantly hooked!!! Just searched up the lyrics and they hit so hard! What a gem this is!!!

it's in sort of a way terrifying how many lyrics I related to. the feeling of loss, inheriting bad parts of my dad and wanting to go back to a time that the one important person in my life was there, but then left as soon as I told her my true feelings for her. I still see her most days, but it isn't the same. She forgot me while I couldn't forget what we had, and now I'm just half a person, acting like im whole. and all too soon, at the age of 15, while many people in these comments are adults. gotta love life

You found the right words to describe my inner feelings, words my soul could not formulate. This song and it`s lyrics are so relatable, it`s crazy. Every time I listen to this song, I feel like you`re singing about my life... what a master piece.

“So I thought that if I piled something good on all my bad I could cancel out the darkness I inherited from dad” this hits hard. My dad was never in my life and I have his anger, it’s not as bad as his because I’ve never hit someone , but it js hits DEEP .

Had this song been released 10 yrs sooner I would probably be back with my (now) ex. - reminds me of old emotions.  Instead I’m in a relationship with a different, wonderful woman I am proud to call my wife.  Not thinking I’ve missed out, just nice to reflect on growth mentally and physically

You know, that set of lyrics "And I’ll dream each night of some version of you that I might not have but I did not lose" gave me a realization. Even if things went sour, even if things hurt now, you can always run around in your memories and spend time with them back when things were good. Because it was, and that's okay, and though it may have changed, you still experienced it. You still loved one another, in a safe space, and that person is still there! Just in your head. And that's not too bad, really.
Looking for a song that I lost, and this ain't it, but  the beats good
I just found this guys music recently, his lyrics are so fantastic :)
Ugh this song makes me feel so emotional because it feels so relatable.

This is honestly a perfect song. Even the lyrics that dont apply to me directly induce empathy. "I'll dream each night of some version of you that I might not have but I did not lose" hits anyone thats had a past relationship (even if you've moved on and are happy).  "I am no longer funny because I miss the way you laugh" is accurate to after a breakup when you find yourself laughing but then get sad bc you think about how that happy moment could have been shared with your ex. The "darkness inherited from dad" doesnt apply to me but I've seen it in my friends, SOs, and family members.

The song is a 14/10 but this lyric video sucks. half the lyrics dont show up on screen until theyve already been sung. lyric videos are meant for people to sing along which doesnt work when the words arent there
i love these lyrics omg
So much emotion from this song. This Poem in song form completes the masterpiece. Love it
Love this blue grass/ folksy/ dispatchy vibe in his songs. So sad but uplifting at the same time

this songs vocals are just gorgeous and the lyricism is so smooth and poetic.... augh i luv this song
I just heard this song on Jimmy Fallon. I missed the artist's name but I recalled some of the lyrics. Super glad I found it.

Heard half of this while flipping through Sirius stations.  That half was enough to make me search up the whole song.  It brings me back to my introduction to Dashboard Confessional.  I had never felt so impacted and encompassed by current music until DC, and the connection that Chris had/has with his fans, both individually and as a crowd, was so powerful.  It was amazing to be a part of that, and this song just brought me back to those days and those feelings.
“And I’ll dream each night of some version of you” might be one of the deepest quotes you’ll hear so hold onto it with your soul
Does anyone else hear "fuck your mom" instead of "saw your mom"  ? All the lyrics say saw but it's not what I hear at all.
Hopefully I don’t get too much hate for it but .75x is just too good not to share for others to hear, wow what a vibe

Yeah,... idk. Keep throwing sticks in my yard. Maybe they came from one of the 29 trees i have out there, but im always suspicious of the red ones which appear to be broken at both ends, still very green, yet the leaves have been obviously removed.  Could i have a random wild goat dropping them on my walk? Idk. But im still gonna burn em. As for lyrics seems kinda jumping all over the place. Having demonic friends in high places can definatly help overlook any raw talent one might have. Weather or not there's a longjivity to this psyops will only be told in time. Jump forward 15 years and idk. I can see how starved all are today for new material. They eat up the blandest songs treating them as golden chunks of caviar when in reality it was simply fish guts.
He wrote the lyrics to my relationship with my x, except it’s more than 1/2 his fault 😢
Heard this on the radio waiting for my mom to come back in from Walmart, so many relatable lyrics I knew I’d be drinking to it when I got home.
Catchiest chorus ever. Had I stuck in my head for a month, no bs.

I am so in Love with this song.. I wished i wrote it 💕 it seems happy at first, but ironically there is a lot of pain in it once you realize the lyrics are quite deep.. And maybe because i can relate to this "in between" feeling.. I am addicted to the Song 💕 though i would find it interesting to see what happens with the emotions and text, if the tempo would drop just a bit.
something abt this song makes me feel like i relate to it on an emotional level, i can’t but i really feel like i do
Wow!! What a great unique and soulful raspy voice, just discovered Noah listening to Stingrays channel plus Sirius radio in My Jeep. Another amazing artist out there!!

GREAT JOB NOAH. Wow. A Vermont love song. Thank you for providing us with your beautiful lyrics. I've listened to you several times now. Just found u via NPR. I've dabbled in a little music myself.. From one Vermont artist to another, I wish you much success. This was my FIRST original song. I would love your artistic input, just in case you ever see this comment: https://youtu.be/WbOaUKLZh3I
It feels like this is a song that my subconscious wrote.. I'm crying right now, but I so deeply appreciate that this song exists.
YOU ONCE CALLED ME FOREVER BUT NOW YOU STILL CAN’T CALL ME BACK. Emotional damage. 💔
"So I thought that if I piled something good on all my bad That I could cancel out the darkness I inherited from dad" just emotionally hit me harder than any lyric ever written

this song...it hurts but i can't help but come back again and again. so many of lyrics feel like a punch to the heart and yet it's comforting at the same time. i'm not sure any song has ever felt this way for me before

I have been listening to this guy for 4 years and I just got into playing a ukulele so when this banger came out I instantly fell in love because it's an amazing song and I was able to learn the chords by ear and play it

I absolutely love the pictures in the video. A little hard to read the lyrics, partly because I'm so distracted of the beautiful scenes changing ❤️ I love this artist. The lyrics to his songs are always so well worded. I love them. Like in the beginning? What a lyrical genius. The fact that's its very upbeat is great. I love the little strumming solos too. It  makes me want to get a drum, and go along with the song. Great all around. good Job Noah! :)
Hit song otw.  Great lyrics and depth.  Thanks 😊
God damn it the beginning of the chorus reminds me of an old song and I can't place. The way he sings "and I love Vermont but it's the season of the sticks"
The chorus of this song reminds of another song. Anyone else?

I was divorced in February after 20 years together and 17 married. Happier now but many memories still. This one had me tearing up even though it was for the best. Another great song that helped me through it was" I sat by the ocean" BY QUEENS OF THE STONE AGE. Living in Waterbury VT now and couldn't be happier!
Each of the verses in this song strikes me so deeply… except the part where his friends come home for Christmas. I don’t have those
The vibe!!!!! Like kdbdks that’s the only way I can explain it omg!!!
This song will stay on repeat for the rest of the day! Love it! Gives me Llewyn Davis vibes! So much soul!
This is excellent song writing. There were a few absolutely gem lyrics and it definitely succeeded in making me cry.

Man ever since this song got released, I've been listening to it everyday. There's just something about it that pulls me in even though I have never been to america much less vermont. Noah has such a way with storytelling and interweaving it into the most fitting melody. I'm glad to have discovered him all those years ago because of that one choreography to one of his songs. 100/10, have been and always will be a fan of his music.
Just wow. Hit the nail on the head for the vibe of 2022.
Can't tell you how much I love this man's work, always hits me deeply.
I still have to take deep breaths and calm my shaking soul when I pass that exit
I can't get enough of this song! There's a  emotional freedom I find in Noah's music, it's intoxicating.

Been listening to this for a week now. Whilst it didn't hit me like Godlight it's still got its own quality and is damn catchy to boot. Stoked to hear Noah thinks it's his best work. That guy so deserves to be happy. His songs over the past few years have given me such joy. They make me think about my life, family, friends the great things to be had as well as the hard dark times that hit us all when we're not looking. Keep living, dreaming and making those beautiful tunes Mr Kahan. Ps- Hit us up down here in Australia when you get the chance.💚✌️💙
I wish you didn't remove that part between part one and chorus, where u'd go "I'm Fu*ked, and u suck and this sucks...."... that was a bridge, transition...
Love this - the speed feels like when emotions finally come spilling out
I would get every single lyric of this song on me I'm so obsessed and emotional😆💗 his song writing is so perfect
This song has a nostalgic sound and the chorus makes me feel like dancing around in circles lol. I love it
After my girlfriend plays this song 19 times in a row it gets annoying lol

Hey Noah, I've been listening for the past year. I wonder if you could work on less produced maybe live version? Maybe with a little more distance between the verses. I felt like this song still has so much potential. I'd like more instrumentals in this song and a slower pace. Maybe I'll cover it and try and work something up.
God I love  good lyrics

Even if I don’t relate to the lyrics in this exact moment in life, his words bring me right back to a moment I felt exactly this way. He is so impressive and I’m so grateful we have this outlet thanks to him 🙌🏼

If you enjoy Noah Kahan songs,  I love you so! Who wouldn't love a person who enjoy these genius weaving of words? And oh, it's a Noah thing, the irony of his lyrics and melody is always a delicious treat for the ears and soul.

New fan here! I recently discovered your music and I can’t even describe how much your music makes me feel ok. I don’t really tell people but I live with depression that’s only ever really weighing me down, but when I listen to what you sing and the lyrics behind it, everything just dissipates and I feel understood in a lot of ways. Wishing you so much success Noah!!

i really like his music, because i think the lyrics are sooo relatable 🫶🏻
This song was pretty nice, from the beat, to the guitar and lyrics. Love that we're getting new music
I am going to cry, what a beautiful and heartbreaking masterpiece. Noah, you always know how to express ineffable emotions so perfectly. Stunning.
I've been waiting for this for too long and it was worth it. The emotion in Noah's voice is painful and transferring to me. 🙏🙏🙏
Like a deep sigh....finally 😌

There is a specific feeling I got when I hear Noah's song, I don't know what that is, maybe the feeling of being heard of some situations, or maybe some kind of nostalgic, or maybe comfortable, or maybe joy, I don't know, but his song is surely masterpiece.

it really wasn't what i was expecting, and i mean this in a good way. there's a hint of nostalgia to the lyrics that's juxtaposed with this youthful innocence that's forced to accept the bitter reality of life...it makes me sad and somewhat comforted at the same time because it tells me that i'm not the only one feeling this way
